intro: Hydrangea xanthoneura var. lancifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaf hydrangea, is a deciduous shrub native to East Asia. It features large, showy inflorescences that can range in color from white to pink, depending on soil pH. The plant has opposite, lance-shaped leaves that are typically dark green and have a slightly serrated edge. It thrives in partial shade and moist, well-drained soil, making it a popular choice for ornamental gardens. The flowers bloom in late spring to early summer, adding a striking visual element to the landscape.
